title: Ronaldo Viana
text:
Ronaldo Aparecido Viana, known as Ronaldo Viana (born 7 January 1979) is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> midfielder.
Club career.
Born in <a href="Vera%20Cruz%20do%20Oeste">Vera Cruz do Oeste</a>, he played with <a href="W%20Connection%20F.C.">W Connection</a> between 2002 and 2008. During the winter of the 2003–04 season, he was loaned to Serbian club <a href="FK%20%C5%BDeleznik">FK Železnik</a> along <a href="Gefferson%20Goulart">Gefferson Goulart</a>. Both stayed till next winter, playing the second half of the <a href="2003%E2%80%9304%20First%20League%20of%20Serbia%20and%20Montenegro">2003–04</a> and first half of the <a href="2004%E2%80%9305%20First%20League%20of%20Serbia%20and%20Montenegro">2004–05 First League of Serbia and Montenegro</a> seasons. He made two appearances in the 2004–05 season.
He spent some time back in Brazil afzer leaving W Connection in 2007 and he played with <a href="Trindade%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Clube">Trindade Atlético Clube</a> during first semester of 2009. He then returned to Trinidad and Tobago and signed a 10-month deal with <a href="San%20Juan%20Jabloteh%20F.C.">San Juan Jabloteh</a> in April 2010. By September 2010 he moved to Antigua and Barbuda and signed a 6-months deal with <a href="Parham%20FC">Parham</a>. He played again with <a href="San%20Juan%20Jabloteh%20F.C.">San Juan Jabloteh</a> during the season 2012–13.
